panels.visual: FULL PAGE SPLASH: Thirteen-year-old Iksha in servant's garb freezes outside her father's study. The door is slightly ajar. Her water jug has slipped from nerveless fingers and lies shattered on the marble floor. Her face is a mask of horror as she overhears the conversation that will seal her fate - or set her free. Through the doorway, the silhouettes of her father and uncle can be seen discussing her like merchandise.
panels.dialogue: UncleAdvisor: "She's your fifth daughter, Kanishka. What did you expect? The elder girls went to better matches. Iksha is... surplus. We're fortunate the Shahi wants her at all."
panels.narration: The Shahi was fifty-three and had six wives already. Iksha heard her own name spoken like a commodity. Surplus. She had two years before they sent her away to bear children for a stranger, locked in another palace, her mind and spirit crushed beneath the weight of duty.
